docs.title: Welcome to the portfolio of Jorge Giménez
My journey
docs.text:
With over two decades of experience since 2000 as an analyst and developer of computer applications, I have a proven track record in creating innovative software solutions. As of May 2024, I have expanded my expertise to include Data Science. My skill set encompasses the full data science pipeline:

  • Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Proficient in using advanced table description packages to uncover patterns and insights within complex datasets.

  • Data Visualization: Skilled in leveraging the latest web technologies to create dynamic and interactive visualizations that communicate data-driven stories effectively.

  • Modeling and AI: Experienced in developing sophisticated models, including those based on Artificial Intelligence, to predict outcomes and drive strategic decision-making.

My multifaceted background allows me to bridge the gap between software development and data science, enabling organizations to harness technology and data for optimal performance.

docs.title: Data Science and other Python projects
docs.text:
4/ Iris dataset query as a web application : Data science project about Iris dataset exploration

3/ ML_Project_YouTube_keyword_optimization : Data science project about US stocks prediction

2/ Billboard Hot 100 : EDA project about this dataset at Kaggle

1/ Battleship in Spanish (Hundir la Flota) : Python project emulating Battleship board. It is in Spanish language

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
1. First install Python 3.10.11 or above
  2. Install pip sh py https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py

  3. Choose one of the following solutions:

  4. Install Jupyter Notebook

    sh pip install notebook

  5. Install Visual Studio Code, click on this link

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Clone the repo sh git clone https://github.com/jorgegmayorgas/ML_Project_YouTube_keyword_optimization.git
  2. Install Python libraries sh pip install -r installed_packages.txt

(back to top)

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
Open with Jupyter Notebook or Visual Studio Code

   results_final_ml_project_youtube_keywords_optimization.ipynb

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to learn, inspire, and create. Any contributions you make are greatly appreciated.

If you have a suggestion that would make this better, please fork the repo and create a pull request. You can also simply open an issue with the tag "enhancement". Don't forget to give the project a star! Thanks again!

  1. Fork the Project
  2. Create your Feature Branch (git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature)
  3. Commit your Changes (git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature')
  4. Push to the Branch (git push origin feature/AmazingFeature)
  5. Open a Pull Request

(back to top)

docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: A simple, modern and readable HTML template for APIs documentations
docs.text: You can take a look with this DEMO. \ Or this other One Content Column DEMO.

docs.title: What's new in the latest version :
docs.text:
• Fix list on 3 content columns <ul> and <ol>.
  • Removed jQuery usage to vanilla js.
  • Update of css fonts.
  • Fix menu with long text.
  • Updated Google Font call.
  • Removed usage of Roboto Condensed font.
  • Updated menu data-target to use content.
  • Added .central-overflow-x util class to avoid overflows.
  • Added .break-word util class to avoir overflows without adding a scrollbar.
  • Added optional Version & Last updated infos
  • Added responsive menu with burger icon menu button.

docs.title: Credits
docs.text:
• Google Font (Roboto|Source+Code+Pro)
  • Highlight.js 9.8.0
  • A Creative Common logo: platform by Emily van den Heever from the Noun Project.

docs.title: How to use it
docs.text:
This is a simple HTML template, do whatever you want with this !

To use One Content Column Version, don't forget to add one-content-column-version css class to <body> like in one-content-column.html file.

docs.title: Utils CSS class
docs.text:
If you have an element in central column that overflow on third column, you can add it central-overflow-x css class to prevent it.

Example: 

<table class="central-overflow-x">...<table>

If you doesn't want a scrollbar, you can use break-word css class to prevent it.

Example: 

<code class="higlighted break-word">http://api.westeros.com/with-a-very-very-very-very-very-long-end-point-url/get<table>

docs.title: Contributors
docs.text: Special thanks to TheStami for his contribution creating One Content Column version !

docs.title: Contribute
docs.text:
We're always looking for:

  • Bug reports, especially those for aspects with a reduced test case
  • Pull requests for features, spelling errors, clarifications, etc.
  • Ideas for enhancements
